meanings.definition: A blood-sucking insect of the Triatoma genus, known for transmitting Chagas disease.
meanings.sent1: The conenose can transmit a serious disease through its bite.
meanings.sent2: I saw a conenose in the woods and quickly moved away to avoid getting bitten.
meanings.sent3: The conenose decided to have a feast on my arm, but I politely declined.
meanings.sent4: The conenose's bite was like a tiny needle injecting discomfort into my skin.
meanings.sent5: The conenose's presence filled me with dread, knowing the danger it carried.

meanings.sent1: Please don't conenose me with your constant tapping on the table.
meanings.sent2: The loud music started to conenose the neighbors, prompting complaints.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door seemed to conenose everyone in the house, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the alarm clock conenosed me awake every morning.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of the fly around my head was beginning to conenose me.
